title: Bolsonaro’s Team Makes Late Bid to Overturn Brazil’s Election
description: President Jair Bolsonaro’s campaign said votes from about 60 percent of voting machines should be thrown out because of a software bug. Independent experts say the bug does not affect the vote’s integrity.

title: Pope Compares Russia’s War in Ukraine to Stalin-Era Famine That Killed Millions
description: The comparison to Stalin’s decision to let millions in Ukraine starve represents one of the pope’s strongest condemnations yet of the Russian invasion.

title: G7 and Allies Hit Snag Over Setting Price Cap on Russian Oil
description: The effort to negotiate a cap on the price of Russian oil is expected to resume, but when and where is not clear.

title: Your Thursday Briefing: Bombs Kill a Teenager in Jerusalem
description: Plus: Blackouts in Ukraine, Japan’s soccer triumph and an A.I. Thanksgiving menu.

title: G7 and allies hit snag over setting price cap on Russian oil.
description: E.U. diplomats meeting in Brussels failed to reach agreement on Wednesday but plan to resume talks.

title: Russian Rocket Strikes Maternity Ward, Killing Newborn, Ukraine Says
description: “Grief fills our hearts,” a regional official said.

title: US Bolsters Ukrainian Air Defenses and Long-Range Artillery
description: A new shipment of $400 million in matériel underscores Ukraine’s battlefield priorities: shooting down waves of Russian missiles while continuing to push back Moscow’s ground forces.

title: Thieves Steal Ancient Gold Coins From German Museum
description: The theft played out like the plot of a movie. The artifacts could be worth $1.7 million if sold to dealers — or $260,000 if melted down.

title: UK Acknowledges Signs of Race Disparity Over Joint Enterprise Cases
description: The government recognition that “joint enterprise” prosecutions may “affect some groups disproportionately,” an apparent first, followed a Times investigation.

title: Squatters Can Stay at a Russian Tech Entrepreneur’s Mansion in Amsterdam, a Dutch Court Rules
description: The owner of the house is Arkady Volozh, the founder of the Russian tech colossus Yandex, who stepped aside after coming under E.U. sanctions.

title: The European Parliament Backs Designating Russia as a State Sponsor of Terrorism
description: The European Union’s only directly elected institution called on the bloc to “further isolate Russia internationally.”

title: BBC Could Have Been More Critical of Russia During 2018 World Cup, Its Commentator Says
description: Gary Lineker, a former England player and prominent TV presenter, said the broadcaster made a “mistake” that it would learn from in Qatar.

title: Squatters Can Stay at a Russian Oligarch’s Mansion in Amsterdam, a Dutch Court Rules
description: The owner of the house is Arkady Volozh, the founder of the Russian tech colossus Yandex, who stepped aside after coming under E.U. sanctions.

title: Haunted by Disaster, Volunteers Search for Survivors in Indonesia
description: Amid aftershocks and landslides from Monday’s deadly quake in West Java, bands of volunteer rescuers have put aside their daily lives to save others.

title: U.K. Supreme Court Bars Scotland From Unilateral Independence Referendum
description: In a setback to Scottish nationalists, the judges ruled that a second referendum on breaking away from London needed the consent of the British Parliament.

title: Ukraine Prepares for Prolonged Blackouts From Russian Attacks
description: With few power plants left undamaged, Ukraine’s government is warning of the possibility of widespread outages.

title: Marijuana Majority
description: Americans support marijuana legalization, but many of their political leaders do not.

title: Lebanese Shepherds Accused of Spying Along Disputed Border With Israel
description: Lebanese herders say that Israel crosses an ill-defined frontier to abduct and interrogate them. Israel accuses the herders of espionage on behalf of Hezbollah.

title: How Iran’s Security Forces Use Ambulances to Suppress Protests
description: Witness accounts and video analysis reveal how the state is co-opting ambulances to infiltrate demonstrations and detain protesters.

title: Earth Now Has 8 Billion Humans. This Man Wishes There Were None.
description: For the sake of the planet, Les Knight, the founder of the Voluntary Human Extinction movement, has spent decades pushing one message: “May we live long and die out.”

title: Read Your Way Through Tangier
description: Tangier’s many facets have long inspired writers. Here, the Moroccan-born novelist Laila Lalami introduces readers to the books and writers that, to her, best capture the city.

title: Two Explosions in Jerusalem Kill 1 and Wound at Least 13
description: The two explosions occurred at bus stops during the morning rush hour in what were believed to be the first bomb attacks on Israeli civilians since 2016.

title: Two Blasts in Jerusalem Kill 1 and Wound at Least 13
description: The two explosions occurred at bus stops during the morning rush hour in what were believed to be the first bomb attacks on Israeli civilians since 2016.

title: Your Wednesday Briefing
description: A closer look at the state of the war in Ukraine.

title: Missiles for Poland May Disrupt NATO’s Stance on Ukraine War
description: NATO is determined to help Ukraine battle Russia, but wants no direct part of the war. A new promise of air defense weapons for Poland may make that more complicated.
